column4: Guys, I am getting a message "There is still a process running in this terminal. Closing the terminal will kill it." when I try to close GNOME Terminal. It happens when 'mc' is running, which makes sense, but can I somehow make an exception for the message if only 'mc' is running?
why dont you just exit it?
yeah, but i'm used to just closing the terminal, and letting mc terminate.
